name: PEEKABOOM
description:
PEEKABOOM is an asymmetrical 1v1 VR/PC local multiplayer hide&seek game, inspired by innovative works like Panoptic.

How to Play

The Rebel has to collect cyber-bombs from vending machines and destroy two out of the three energy hubs that connect the evil Sentinel to the city. To be able to hide in plain sight and move undetected under the vigilant eye of the Sentinel, the Rebel is equipped with a handy Holo-Disguise-Device™ which makes it possible to assume the appearance of any citizen closeby. Be warned though - the surveillance cameras can still detect you if you move around carelessly and the Sentinel will quickly pick up on any deviation from the class-based behaviour of the different citizens.

The Sentinel can prophylactically scan the citizens with a completely harmless* CitiScan™ scanner ray. Grateful subjects will always react by voluntarily and willingly greeting their benevolent overlord with one of the three prescribed class-based greeting emotes. If the Sentinel detects an illegal abnormality in one of the citizens’ behaviour, they are authorized to use the Stunergy™ stun gun and apply a non-lethal* dose of concentrated energy on the suspect. Accidentally stunning a law-abiding citizen is unfortunately unacceptable and will lead to an emergency shutdown of the Sentinel, in which case the pesky Rebel would win.

Currently, the prototype only works in local multiplayer on Windows 10 with an Oculus Rift, Oculus Rift S or Oculus Quest (with Oculus Link). The PC player can play with mouse and keyboard or gamepad.

Development Background

This game prototype has been developed as part of an internal game jam at GLUON STUDIOS, our new studio for (serious) games, interactive installations and audiovisual content (formerly known as 42dp Labs).

We would sincerely appreciate any kind of feedback, which you can post in the community section below or send to us via email to hi@gluonstudios.com. 

Keep in mind, though, that this is just a rough game jam prototype and not a polished demo or a full game. It contains the occasional placeholders and bugs that you can expect from this stage of development, so please bear with us. ;)

Many of the implemented 3D assets are based on the POLYGON - Sci-Fi City Pack from Synty Studios, which we can highly recommend for saving time in rapid prototyping projects like these.
